oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ||kabbo (Jantje) (II)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: When an eland has been shot, |kaggen (the Mantis) buzzes in the hunters' ears, stands on their eyebrows and looks in their quivers to find the 'offending' arrow. He looks at the bowstrings to see if they have been used. 1) This story is found in Book II-36.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: What |kaggen does when an eland has been shot
